The genre\u2019s lyrics are littered with smart metaphors, witty similes and references to pop culture; all of which only make the music more enjoyable.
A big part of the attraction of hip-hop is the fact that any youth with a microphone and a decent amount of creativity can become a rapper. The vibrant, energetic style of the genre draws from a variety of different cultures, with vibrant colors and bold patterns being staples of the scene.`),mdx("h2",null,"It\u2019s inherently African-American"),mdx("p",null,`One of the things that makes hip-hop so special is the fact that it is a predominantly African-American form of art. It is a product of a specific culture and draws on the history and experiences of black Americans in a way that no other genre does.
There is a certain pride that comes with being part of a culture that has endured such racist prejudices and oppression. It\u2019s a reminder that no matter how much governments or the media try to sweep it under the rug, African-American culture will always be there to assert its presence.

But the scene has always fought back against oppression, with many rappers using their art as a means of raising awareness about social issues.`),mdx("h2",null,"It\u2019s non-commercial and underground"),mdx("p",null,`As a predominantly non-commercial form of music, hip-hop is not driven by profit. It\u2019s not connected to any record company, and it\u2019s not on a mission to make as much money as possible. It\u2019s an underground, non-profit scene that is driven by creativity.
All those fancy stadiums and million-dollar sponsorship deals don\u2019t apply to hip-hop. The concerts remain small, accessible affairs and the rappers remain independent artists.
And this is undoubtedly one of the reasons why the genre is so appealing. It is a refreshing change from the glossy, overproduced tunes that make up the majority of the music scene. The lyrics are not censored, and the artists have the freedom to talk about the things that matter to them.
Indeed, many hip-hop artists are true revolutionaries \u2013 using music as a means of spreading awareness about important social issues.`),mdx("h2",null,"It can be an empowering force for youth"),mdx("p",null,`Hip-hop has always been a voice for the young people of society.
